page.title: 05Industry The Boatyard
page.content: {Rowhedge}has been associated with boats and boat building for more than 200 years. Roughly between the l870's and the Second World War most families were involved in fishing and professional yachting which included the King's{"Britannia"}and the America Cup yachts{"Endeavour"}and{"Shamrock". There is now only{Ian Brown's {Yard.}Here{lifeboats}are serviced throughout the year and during the winter up to 70 small yachts are laid up. Other work includes repairs, alterations, and the fitting out of boats, the biggest of which is the {Ocean Youth Club's}boat{"Master {Builder".}Nine people work at the Yard and during our visit they were servicing the Walton and Clacton Lifeboat{"The City of Birmingham"}no. 48-005.
